Reviews.Title: “another great trip”
Reviews.Author: mopsey50
Reviews.Content: I love coming to Branson and I love to stay at the Grand Plaza. I think I have stayed with the Grand for the past 5 years and have always been happy. I have a issue they are always nice and helpful.Even helpful getting tickets for shows.

Reviews.Title: “Nice get a way”
Reviews.Author: LipseyJ
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Branson August 23-26, 2012. I checked out reviews on hotels and the only problem I saw this hotel had was they only had two elevators for all the floors. We booked anyways and were very pleased. I could see if they were booked where there could be a problem. But it was well worth the stay. Price was good and the rooms were very clean. Breakfast was WONDERFUL!!! I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie N
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very pleasant surprise!! It was right in the middle of the action and a block or two off the strip. The hotel staff was extremely pleasant, the free breakfast was outstanding, and the room was a great size, beds/pillows comfortable, and ammenities were exactly as stated. Loved the free internet too! Thanks for adding to a great stay at Branson for a reasonable cost!

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury hotel!”
Reviews.Author: linda R
Reviews.Content: This is not a luxury hotel, as it is advertised. The rooms are small and ordinary. The pool is small and ordinary. There are only 2 elevators for the entire hotel, one of which doesn't work properly and they are sooooo slow. The only thing this hotel has going for it is the breakfast, which is not great, but is convenient and available.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: lilbit1339
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay. Room was comfortable, with very little outside noise. Staff was very friendly. Great view of the mountains while eating the buffet breakfast each morning. They did have some issues with the elevators while we were there. We did have to walk downstairs at one point to leave the hotel, but they were operating when we returned from our day out. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a great hotel go to the Grand Plaza in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Sandy E
Reviews.Content: We always like to stay at the Plaza when going to Branson. The beds are comfy, rooms are clean and the staff is always friendly and very helpful. The food is excellent, both breakfast and dinner. We enjoyed visiting with the owner of the restaurant, and learned he is a former professional baseball player. You pay a little more for the room, but they pay attention to details, plus the breakfast makes up for the difference. It is a wonderful place to stay in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a few issues.”
Reviews.Author: Eufaula_J
Reviews.Content: My family and I had quite a few issues upon checking in the hotel. The older lady working at the front desk needs to learn how to treat customers better. In my opinion she was not very nice at all when I checked in. We had to move rooms three different time before the hotel staff got things correct. We have been loyalty members for about 4-5 years and this was the worst stay that we have had. I think that when we come to Branson next time we will decide to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else...or run!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: seedls36
Reviews.Content: I had 2 rooms for my family. july2-8. I reserved the second room for July 3-8th. i needed to add an extra day for my room, and booked and paid for it online, the staff then tried to charge me for that room when i left. I had to log on to their computer, pull up all my reservations, print them, to prove that i paid for 2 rooms for 6 nights each, because they could not find my reservation thru their paperwork. having already paid 900 for 6 nights, i surely did not want to add another 100 plus. this was very inconveniant for me and my family and i at check out. On july 5th, the fire alarms went off in hotel. i was outside, so i didnt know, but my husband came out later, and said they were going off, and had he not left the rooms, he would not have known, because he could not hear it in the room. he actually thought it was the elevator stuck, because of course they would not work with fire alarms, so he walked down the stairs, still not knowing it was a fire alarm until he got to main level. we still had one of our teenagers in the other room, unaware of any alarm going off, because as i said, u could not hear them. so we had to rush up the stairs, and get her. UNBEILIEVABLE!!!!! come to find out it was just thier boiler room overheating, because no air-conditioning in the kitchen on the 9th floor. room servers were bringing food to people who ordered earlier in the day, complaining it was like 112 in the kitchen, made me sick thinking of sweat all over my food, and these poor people working in those conditions. they did not get the elevators running till like 2 in the morning, so anybody wanting to go back to their rooms had to travel up to 8 floors, using the stairs. there was a poor older lady in lobby with a pacemaker, she couldnt make it that far, her meds were in her room, and rather than give her a different room, and get her things, she was made to sit in the lobby for hours. I got in the hot tub, and a tiny spash of water got in my eyes, and it burned terribly and immediatly, i couldnt even open it for awhile. I own a pool, and its always clean, and never requires chlorination so bad that it burns anybody the way this pool and hot tub did. the breakfast was ok, it was free, but if it did cost, i would not have bought it forsure. the staff and the young man and lady who cleaned our rooms daily were great. the staff at check out on the eighth, were not however, or should i say just the one young lady, who accussed me of not paying and made me look up and print my proof of purchase for this establishment. there are so many nifty mom and pop places aand other places to stay in branson, stay away from this place!!!!!!! Oh yes there is not a vent in bathroom, i read other reviews and the manager said if you hold a tissue to it it sucks the tissue to it......WRONG!!!!!! I had to go buy a can of air freshner, because everytime someone used the bathroom, it stunk up the whole room for hours..not good

Reviews.Title: “The Get Away”
Reviews.Author: seaweedhittintheroad
Reviews.Content: The place was great excellant breakfast on the 9th floor all glass overlooking Branson easy access to the strip clean and comfortable rooms only problem for us was the parking had to park around to the front which is all on a steep hill other than that had a great stay everyone was helpful and friendly Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Average Joe hotel”
Reviews.Author: whitby44
Reviews.Content: Me and me family 3 people all together stayed on the 7th floor in the double queen size room . Pros. - *breakfast was free and good * easy access from the strip * friendly tickett saleswoman in the front lobby * clean pool Cons.- * the room cleaners did not change the sheets the entire time we was their they just remade the bed I know this because I spilt koolaid on my sheet the first night and it was still their yesterday. I think my cleaner was brandette * elevators are extremely slow * hotel was not on the strip * heavily chlorinated pool ,but atleast you know its clean So in this case the cons are even with the pros an average hotel , most likely wouldn't stay their again

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: maydog06
Reviews.Content: This hotel really tries to make your vacation a wonderful experience! It started when we checked in. We were given a double queen room, and we reserved a mini suite. The staff was very apologetic and courteous, and corrected the mistake promptly. The rooms had new beds, new bedding, flat screen tv's, good soap(dial in dispensers, first time I'd seen that) and new drapes. The free breakfast at the top of the hotel was a nice touch. The only two concern's I had was the handicapped parking limitations, and the food variety. I understand keeping costs down while offering something most other hotels don't offer, and that is fabulous. But for a little more variety, like say, putting out all three meats they serve instead of alternating the meats by days, and using better eggs, I would pay ten to fifteen bucks more a night for that. With the handicapped parking issue, I would suggest making more of the top level handicapped(or all of the top level handicapped, since there isn't much parking up there anyway), or maybe adding a valet service. They do offer to park your car for you if you can't climb the mountain that is the rear parking, and that is pretty nice. Overall, it's a great family hotel, and I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with great service”
Reviews.Author: Chris C
Reviews.Content: I made hotel arrangements through Branson Tourism Center using their recommendations and found the Grand Plaza Hotel to be affordable and convenient to the shows and attractions we were going to see. We had a 3 pm check in time but the room was not ready. The front desk staff offered to call my cell phone when the room was ready. The second day of our stay we requested a roll away bed and had it within less than 30 minutes. Any contact I had with any of the staff was pleasant (from the desk to housekeeping). I will be more than happy to stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Moldy room...”
Reviews.Author: Nick B
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at the hotel and it has been okay overall. Pros: Plenty of fresh towels, sheets and pillows. Free breakfast in the mornings was really good. Friendly staff. Cons: Smaller than expected rooms. Only 2 elevators so you might wait several minutes for a ride during peak times. Not enough parking on the ground walk-in level. Having to park on the backside and climb two sets of steep stairs is hard with kids and strollers in tow. No exhaust fans in bathroom. The worst part: My family of four woke up this morning with stuffy noses. I think I found the cause: mold. In a corner of the room I noticed water damaged wall paper and black mold spots. I peeled a little of the wallpaper back and found more mold. I also found mold in the inside lid of our ice bucket. Both things are hard to miss and I can't understand why the hotel chooses to ignore them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday weekend”
Reviews.Author: Surfingirlbo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and comfortable. We stayed her on a Saturday night and had a wonderful room with a jet tub in it. Room was clean the people were nice and the bartender in the lounge was fabulous! I would recommend it and will stay here again if we ever come back to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice but it is a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Benstew
Reviews.Content: Over all this was a decent hotel. Pretty clean rooms that are just average in size and amenities. The kids loved the indoor pool and the parents loved that we could sit out side and still watch the kids in the pool. The free hot breakfast on the top floor was a nice touch but nothing real special. Only two small elevators and in the mornings with everyone taking advantage of the free breakfast they took forever. Next time in Branson I will try some where else but this is not a bad option.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed.”
Reviews.Author: L S
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure if we just were having a very unlucky week or what. The rooms are way too small for two queen sized beds. We hit our legs into furniture constantly. The pool was closed 4 out of 6 days we were there for repair or cleaning. The toilet ran and flushed all night (maintenance did fix this problem), but the bathtub dripped constantly, of which they could NOT fix. Then finally on our last night the beds were not made, but the towels had been replaced. When we called the front desk they said the staff had gone home and that they could do it possibly but they weren't really sure how. The breakfast was good and that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Judy918
Reviews.Content: This trip was for a group of Senior Citizens. Staff was very courteous. Rooms very nice and clean. The free morning breakfast was excellent. Live music was provided during breakfast . I would defintely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: egyptianwife1977
Reviews.Content: We arrived and I was really looking forward to seeing this place! It was amazing the only thing I will say is that I wish there was ventilation in the bathrooms. Not to give TMI but to come into your room and smell the bowel movement from the morning or afternoon was not okay. however, that being said that was the ONLY negative on this hotel. The beds were comfortable, bathroom nice soap, shampoo provided. Staff more then willing to make it better if you have a problem or need something. In fact 10 minutes after arriving in the room we were called to make sure we had enough blankets, coffee, etc. I would recommend this hotel and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Nettasue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Plaza over the Memorial Day weekend. What a mistake! Though they have recently redecorated the rooms, it is simply new lipstick on the same old pig! The beds were so terribly uncomfortable, I could not sleep in it. I "slept" sitting up in the chair. Needless to say, I did not get any rest. My husband also tossed and turned. The free breakfast was inedible. It may have been hot, but the eggs were powdered, the biscuits like hockey pucks, and te gravy awful. The parking was pathetic. I actually hunted around for a new hotel, but everything was booked for the holiday weekend. I will never consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: 24me2
Reviews.Content: I read several reviews and was hesitant, but booked anyway. Breakfast was great and breakfast staff was very quick to clean up any messes. The bed and pillows were awesome. We also liked the cookies, water, and apples in the lobby.The negative things were cloudy, very chlorinated pool and slow elevators. I didn't mind the pool too much because I had rather have lots of chlorine to kill germs than not enough.... The elevators were a bit slow on the mornings due to breakfast and check-out, but nothing we couldn't handle. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: valeneh933
Reviews.Content: My eighty-one year old mother bought a vacation package through Branson Getaways and this is the hotel we were assigned. After reading the mixed reviews, my expectations were very low, but we had a wonderful 4 day stay at the Grand Plaza. The front desk personnel were always very friendly and helpful. We hadn't made any special room requests before arriving, but when I asked for a ground level room so mom wouldn't have to climb stairs the front desk found us one. They explained that if we would park in back and come in the back door we could avoid any stairs. I had read several complaints in other reviews about the slow elevators, so we were thrilled not to have to use them except to go up to breakfast. We stayed during their slow season and didn't have any problems waiting for elevators in the mornings. Our room was very clean and appeared to be newly remodeled. I liked the eco friendly options offered for reusing towels and sheets and the dispensers in the showers for shampoo, conditioner and bath gel. The dispensers are mounted up high on the wall behind you, so if you take a bath they aren't very convenient. Good A/C, fridge, large granite vanity inside the bathroom.The indoor pool, hot tub and exercise room all looked nice although we didn't use them. As mentioned in other reviews there is no fan in the bathroom for ventilation, it wasn't a huge problem, but I did notice it. Our room did not have a "do not disturb" sign to set out and I didn't see any others on our floor. The maid did knock on our door fairly early one morning, but didn't disturb us again when my sister told her we would be staying a few more days. Our room was always nicely made up when we got back at the end of the day. The location was excellent being centered about half way along the strip. The breakfast was great with scrambled eggs, fried potatoes, sausage or ham, oatmeal, waffles, juices, hot chocolate, pastries (the mini chocolate muffins were my favorite) yogurt, cereal and fresh fruit.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: karenpStLouis
Reviews.Content: Got this room through an auction, so cannot base a review on price paid, not sure how much the rooms go for. The hotel was nice and clean. We checked in around 5 and asked how late the hot tub was open, was told midnight. After going back out shopping and dinner, we returned to go to the hot tub around 9 pm, only to find it broken. I think they could have told us this when we asked how late it was open. Or at least had a sign up somewhere so we didnt go up to the room, change into swimsuits, come back down only to find it not working. The free breakfast was very good. They had eggs, ham, biscuits and gravy, potatoes, cereal, waffles, fruit and doughnuts. Best free breakfast buffet I have had in awhile!!

Reviews.Title: “good value, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: budgettraveler55
Reviews.Content: Agree with the other reviewer's positive comments about cleanliness, good breakfast, friendly staff. The location is ideal; close enough to the strip to be convenient, but not right on a busy road. At first, we were given a room on the 8th floor under the kitchen area, but after mentioning I had read the review about these rooms possibly being noisy - the desk staff moved us to a room on the other end of the hall with no problem. Our room overlooked the front parking lot and had a great view of the hills. The breakfast area has better seating than most hotels, and also operates as a restaurant in the evening. We had a reasonably priced supper there on our first evening. The wait staff were very friendly and kept the area quite clean. Elevators were no worse than any other large hotel with many guests. We experienced only a few short waits at peak times. Parking lot is hilly - but so is most of Branson! There is a level area for dropping off luggage. Nice indoor pool and hot tub. Enjoyed the lemon flavored water available in the front lobby. We stayed here as part of a timeshare presentation package - so did not have a choice- but when we return to Branson on our own, will definately consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “front desk needs work”
Reviews.Author: Keith b
Reviews.Content: There are lots of hotels in Branson to stay - stay at any of them. I found the front desk personnel very rude and not wanting to help. If you don't like your job - find a new one. I stayed at the Grand Plaza for a two day event. I arrived in the morning of the 2nd day and no one at the desk knew of the event or where anything was held. they just did not seem interested enough to ask. Finally I ran into one of our members and he guilded me to where we to go. I let the desk know of our organization but no one even cared to write it down for the next guest asking. I was told the room was not ready at 11 am and to come back at 12. Not ready - come back at 1pm. Not ready come back at 2. Then I was told to wait until checkin at 3 pm. No one tried to call and see if the room could be cleaned a bit early. Later I came down and asked for change and was told "we don't give change to the machines. I pointed out that 3 floor are not accepting bills and if you want to come with me and see let's go. Over all the room was nice , the food was good, the location was good. Just a bad front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay for the money hands down”
Reviews.Author: Barry A
Reviews.Content: this is our 4th stay here. we've had various types of rooms and all were clean and comfortable. all the usual amenities. nice showers with the curved shower rods for comfort. good shower pressure and nice shower heads. marble sink tops in the bath. great pillows and plenty of them. comfortable bed. and best of all...QUIET ROOMS!!! another poster (Jeffrey B) said his room was loud and noisy. i don't know where he stayed, but the 4 times we've stayed here it's always been absolutely tomb-like. a lot of the walls are concrete (which would explain it). not every wall of every room is concrete but it helps. i haven't even mentioned the breakfast. it is fantastic. lots of choices and it's GOOD. they have a lounge and a restaurant if you want them as well. we went to the lounge once and it was good. not huge. since we've stayed so many times here, the last stay netted us a 20% discount and some sort of frequent stayers card. that card gets us 20% off everytime we stay here from now on. i easily pay over $100 per night to stay here, given the quality. but this last stay i payed only $71!!!! the best deal in town.

Reviews.Title: “Where I would stay in Branson!”
Reviews.Author: Barb G
Reviews.Content: We were recently there for the NAIA national tournament and our team had the good fortune of staying at the Grand Plaza. We were more than pleased. Richard and his staff were extremely accommodating and always pleasant. Our rooms were clean and the breakfast buffet was perfect for our hungry group. Thanks to you all!

Reviews.Title: “Near the Strip”
Reviews.Author: littleindo
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the second floor of this hotel. We enjoyed the clean rooms and friendly staff. We ate breakfast on the ninth floor which wasn't your typical breakfast. It was like a restaurant and an all you can eat buffet of cold and hot foods. The view was nice and you are very close to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Red neck luxury at white collar prices”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey B
Reviews.Content: Horrible parking, LOUD noisy rooms, cheap plastic and staff in worn out tee shirts are just a few of the amineties. If you like seeing other guest in their pj's and socks for breakfast then this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “a good choice”
Reviews.Author: AMDinMissouri
Reviews.Content: No complaints, we won this at a charitable auction. So like to support businesses that do good things for communities. Room was comfortable, clerk gave us the floor of our choice. the breakfast was plentiful, nice views of Branson. The pool was nice and warm for the winter. Close proximity to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Functional Stay near Outlet Malls and other Branson attractions”
Reviews.Author: sarahtham
Reviews.Content: This hotel, though a little old has all the ammenities you want for a short vacation. The room is fairly standard (701-non smoking) has a mini refrigerator but no microwave. Lots of power outlets, so that's a bonus. Internet is available and quite strong. The rooms have beautiful large windows. Very near(walking distance) to Tangier outlets. Ideal! The swimming pool is wonderful (indoor heated, kids loved it) but the jacuzzi could have been better. Cookies provided on check in. Breakfast is ample. The scrambled eggs were good (according to my son who is a scramble egg connoisseur :) The shower is strong and powerful too. A plus! Bring your own soap as the ones supplied by the hotel melts away too fast.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with stay”
Reviews.Author: obitwriter
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased and satisfied with our stay at the Grand Plaza. The beds were comfortable and the room was very clean. They gave out free cookies at check- in which were delicious. The young lady at the front desk was very friendly. The free breakfast was plentiful with lots of choices, hot and cold. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay at the Grand Plaza”
Reviews.Author: CajunKimo
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Grand Plaza in Branson and I was fairly pleased with our stay. Check in was not very pleasant - the young man checking people in was not very friendly and did not seem to care much for people who were not with a "bus group." He seemed to be in a rush to get rid of me at the desk. Our room was large - we had the family suite and it was very clean. The beds were o.k. but the room definitely needed more chairs. The bathroom in the back bedroom was extremely small. Room needed better lighting. All in all the room was comfortable - maybe because we were so tired from each day's activities. Housekeeping in the early morning were a bit noisy in the hall. Parking was problem as each night after returning to the hotel, I had to park quite a distance and walk up quite a number of steps - never was a spot available close to the doors. It seems like this hotel caters mainly to bus tours. They were helpful in setting up tickets for several shows for us to see - the vouchers were ready when we checked in. I suppose that I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fifth Year In Branson at the Grand Plaza”
Reviews.Author: mopsey50
Reviews.Content: After five years of staying at the Grand Plaza I still have nothing but good things to say.Clean ,nice people,good breakfast comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Sharon D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel through a package and after booking I noticed several negative reviews. We were a bit apprehensive about our choice however had nothing to be concerned about. We had a double queen room on the 6th floor with a nice view of the Ozark Hills. We stayed four night and found our beds to be comfortable and the rooms very clean and quiet. They had several conventions there during the length of our stay and although waiting an extra 5 minutes for an elevator in the am, we would not have know that the hotel was so full. The breakfast was more than your typical continental breakfast with the option of enjoying a nice cappuccino every morning. The concierge was very helpful in booking an additional show we wanted to see. The free warm cookie was a nice touch upon checkin. Parking is the downfall, as the hilly setting can be challenging if you had to park in the front parking lot. Which we did one evening. We would recommend this hotel to any one who wants to be centrally located to all the shows yet not right on the strip. We will stay again if we visit the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dsmith13
Reviews.Content: Had a really good experience at this hotel. Very welcoming at check-in, they even upgraded to a king bed with a jacuzzi tub. They do have a computer to use in the lobby with printing capabilities. I would say the lobby area seems a bit dated. However, the rooms seemed to be recently updated. The hotel is in a great location. It is just south of the strip about a quarter of a mile. So, if you are interested in the shows on the strip, you will have fairly easy access. Also, if you want to try to avoid the busy strip you will have easy access to take the different routes around it. The complimentary breakfast was great. Had about anything you would want...waffles, biscuits and gravy, potatoes, ham, fruit, doughnuts, cereal, coffee, cappuccino, juices...etc. Overall a very good experience, I will say that we received a special rate ($69) as part of property tour package we took elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A LITTLE DATED”
Reviews.Author: JereN4
Reviews.Content: My husband & I came to the hotel because my father's Air Force Reunion chose it for their reunion. The hotel has meeting rooms, suites, a restaurant on the top (9th) floor, indoor pool, exercise room, etc. The hotel sits on a hill, so the entrance into the lobby is on the down-hill side. One must walk up hill from the parkiing lot and/or many steps to enter the lobby. The handicap entrance is on the other side (up-hill side) of the building. Then one must go down one level to the lobby. There are limited handicapped parking spaces on that side of the building. The hotel was probably once a grand hotel, but now is somewhat "dated" and needs a face lift. Every place that I had exposure to was clean. The dining area and lounge area on the 9th floor need to be redecorated and up-graded. The complimentary breakfast included hot meat, scrambled eggs, either grits or oatmeal, fried potatoes, waffles, fruit, cereal, buiscits,donuts, sweet rolls, breads, various juices, coffee & cappichino. There was entertainment at breakfast sometimes. All the hotel staff was very polite, helpful, and took care of any problem right away. If you ever stay here, do NOT stay on the 8th floor on the East side. It is right under the kitchen and you can hear all kinds of banging & noises until 10 PM and it begins at again at 5 AM. We asked to be moved after the first night. Also, there was a problem with the fire alarm and as soon as we got settled in our first room, the alarm went off just outside our room and there was an announcement to leave the building via the stairs. It happened that we didn't have to evacuate. The elevators are automaticaly disabled. Someone told us that happened a few days before, and it happened once again on another day while we were in the 9th floor banquet room. All were false alarms, but nonetheless nerve wracking. This is obviously a "conference" center or ideal for large groups, but I wouldn't return here as a single customer. There are large crowds trying to use the elevators or dining room all at once. All in all, it was an OK stay for what our purpose was. I think when I return, I will look for a newer, more up to date hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Looks nice, but needs work”
Reviews.Author: EMSchick312
Reviews.Content: Based upon the external appearance, I thought this would be a great hotel. Not so much. The pool is way too small for the size of the hotel and so horribly chlorinated, it could ruin your suit. The room was not incredibly clean either. The beds were full size and not queens. The Morning breakfast was a typical continental but lacked any fresh fruit. The hotel was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: dendonmo
Reviews.Content: Stayed the last weekend of July 2011. Had 3 rooms side by side, and had no issue with leaving the doors open and allowing the 7 and 9 year olds to go from room to room. The pool one day had too much chlorine, but seemed fine the next day. The breakfast bar was great and very filling. No issues with the room, thought the beds were good. The cleaning staff on 2nd floor was very cordial and did a fine job cleaning our rooms. Any time you go to Branson, there will be a convention or large group at your hotel. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Grand Plaza. Only two elevators for a 9 story building, seemed like we always were waiting. Didn't care for the quantity of handicap parking, could of used more. Plus the handicap would have to take steps down to LL to the front desk or take the elevator down one floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good value friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Magharrison
Reviews.Content: would stay again, good location excellent food good parking close to everything

Reviews.Title: “lots to do”
Reviews.Author: ChitownSandman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Plaza Hotel. It was in the center of theater district . The employees were friendly and courtious incl. breakfast -was enough and hit the spot. you still had to drive to theaters. they are scattered around town but not that far. The bar and resturant were on the 9 flr. saw three shows/ good to very good. had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the hotel and returned”
Reviews.Author: fredfb
Reviews.Content: Sweetp..Our family was staying at the hotel the same time of the "law enforcement" biker convention. We found them to be very nice and cordial. The property was good. The rooms were good and the staff was very cordial. I would recommend this property. Good location to area shows and close to restuarants. Also, we were able to buy tickets to our shows.

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT stay again!!!”
Reviews.Author: sweetp1234
Reviews.Content: We were not informed when we booked the room that a biker convention had also booked most of the other rooms So the resturant was closed (priate party). they Also roped off half of the parking lot for the bikes, My husband is disabled and had to park down hill quite a distance from the door, also we were on the forth floor and had to take the stairs because the group was holding the elevators, We informed management they laughed and said we know. they finally let him use their service elevator to get back to the room. Also the beds are horrible. The only good thing about the stay was the breakfast. Would NOT recommed !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth your $$$”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTraveler2424
Reviews.Content: Our room was dirty...I mean dirty. The dirt build up on the bathroom door was dirty and the back of the bathroom door was unbelievable. The walls by the room door filthy. The bathtub wouldn't drain. The pool was closed more than it was open. Had to wait and wait some more to check in. The only positive was that the breakfast bar was pretty good, the entertainment with breakfast was a nice surprise. This would be a very last choice for us in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, unfriendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: arkansasmotherof2
Reviews.Content: The hotel, overall, was decent. Breakfast was ample. Great location. However; the staff definitely needs more training on how to treat guests.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Urbanfan616
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Branson for one night over spring break as the weather was not so great while visiting family in Arkansas. We went online and decided on this hotel based on the reviews. We ended up traveling with my mom and got the room at the AARP discount so I felt it was worth it with or without the discount. The rooms were basic rooms but clean. The only two negatives were thin walls (but this is also the case in a lot of hotels) and there was mold on the shower curtain liner (cheap fix--why the hotel doesn't replace is beyond me). Other than that, there was a better than normal breakfast which the kids enjoyed. We would stay here again. We also attended the Dixie Stampede and really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, decent hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: tlowder3
Reviews.Content: Pros- Good location, nice appearance, helpful staff, nice amenities,free wi-fi, full service, good free breakfast, live entertainment, cookies upon arrival and coffee available always, next to Tanger outlets. Cons- hair in bed (they promptly corrected), small rooms, some updating needed. Overall we gave it a 7 out of 10. They staff worked well. It was a nice place to stay. I would try another place next time, but I would stay there again at the right price. My wife did not enjoy the live singer at 7am but we were on the 8th floor and restaurant is on the 9th.

Reviews.Title: “Once nice but mgnmt really needs to start reinvesting”
Reviews.Author: a_midwestern_family
Reviews.Content: Have been staying at this motel for the last 10 yrs., staff is always wonderful but currently shopping for newer accomodations for our family's future visits unless they remodel fast. During most recent stay: dirt/mold around ceiling vents in breakfast area, exterior staining beneath window units, broken coffee pot, broken chair, one side of heater blowing cold air, toilet paper holder missing screws, backs falling off furniture, large stains on chairs, walls, bubbling wallpaper, etc., etc. Some of the mattresses, we assume possibly newer ones, are absolutely rock hard. This is a wonderful motel that is just being allowed to slide into disrepair.

Reviews.Title: “Super Clean - Nice Hotel - Medium Breakfast - Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: 5inOklahoma
Reviews.Content: We came for a quick stay during Christmas Break to see the lights at Silver Dollar City. Got into town at 11:45 a.m. - they let us check in early - very accommodating!! Stashed our luggage and headed to SDC - awesome lights - I highly recommend it! We returned to the hotel around 9:00 p.m. Were chilled from being outside all day and headed to the hot tub and pool. The pool was awesome but the hot tub - it was a green hugh and the air jets were not working. Pretty gross. But the pool was nice - very warm! Breakfast was okay. It is free so it was packed out - mostly families. The biscuits were a little over-cooked - okay - they could have doubled for hockey pucks. The scrambled eggs were good - the waffles were great. There were 3 kinds of juices, a fruit bar (canned fruit), toast, english muffins, 3 kinds of cereal, hot chocolate and coffee. There was also sausage - my daughter said it was really spicy but okay. We all tried really hard to find things we liked - but the breakfast overall was just medium. The breakfast buffet is on the 9th floor - seemed like an odd place for it - but it works. Funny thing - we did request an extra pillow (an earlier post commented it was a monumental thing to ask for) - no one answered in housekeeping so we called the front desk and were told they ran out of pillows at 3:00 p.m. We made due - but the pillows are small and there are only 2 per bed - so bring your own if you are a pillow person. Our room had new carpet and was super clean! We were very, very pleased with our stay, however, will probably just splurge next time for breakfast out. The kids didn't venture into the gameroom but it is off of the pool and had about 8 video games. The workout room was also just off the pool with about 5 machines. Parents were working out while their kids swam. But the pool is larger than the picture looks so there was plenty of room. We went to the Landing on day two. It is a really nice, upscale shopping complex with beautiful architecture and landscaping complete with dancing fountains. There were several restaurants and shops to see. Park at the Bass Pro end - seemed like there were more shops, restaurants and stuff to do on that end. The trolley was cool and ran the length of the landing non-stop.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here four years in a row and will make it five next year.”
Reviews.Author: mopsey50
Reviews.Content: They were kind ,helpful and the breakfast good. Ticket and gift shop was very helpful.When we ask for something they were more than happy to help.It was clean and no funny smells. Lynda from Texas

Reviews.Title: “BRING YOUR OWN PILLOWS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pmc1665477
Reviews.Content: Just finished speaking to the "help" at the front desk and requested a monumental, out-of-line request...we needed two more pillows. The cheap-you know what hotel across the street that is half price 1st Inn Branson has 6 pillows per room. They were filthy so we came across the street....one pillow a piece. The girl at the front desk when I asked said "we only issue two pillows per room". REALLY? At $159.00/night I can't have a g-dang pillow? What is this "issue", are we in the military? She gave me one quite rudely. Dried urine on the restroom door and filth from someones tooth brushing/dental flossing on the mirror which I was going to let go but this just sent me over the edge. The 'service' just isn't there...move on down the line..the price is just more money for them.

Reviews.Title: “Our third trip to Branson and at the Grand Plaza. Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MNgal64
Reviews.Content: I am very concerned about the security especially around the pool area. The two back doors are always open and anyone can enter through there. I also noticed that one did not need a room key to enter that area at all.The breakfast could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lyndaj2
Reviews.Content: We recently hosted our annual 508 Field Artillery Battalion reunion here. We were a bit apprehensive before booking as we had read some "not so complimentary" reviews. We found just the opposite to be true! The hotel is lovely and everyone on staff was so very helpful. We had a fabulous reunion from start to finish. We used "Gathering's Plus" to help us organize and they were fabulous too. One member said he "wished he could stay for three weeks"!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: stewart2010
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stay at your hotel and enjoyed our stay. The staff was friendly, the room was clean and nice,bed was comfortable. The breakfast was very good. We will stay again and will recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for family vacation in Branson, MO”
Reviews.Author: thanwu
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for several times since we started to have family vacation in Branson, MO. It provide good hot breakfast and have a good size indoor pool for children.

Reviews.Title: “Place was dirty, found bug on my pillow.”
Reviews.Author: rickhoff8341
Reviews.Content: We were a members of the LOYALTY CLUB #1253 but will never stay here again. As I was preparing for bed, my said look at your pillow and i found a bug about 1 inch long on my pillow. I saved the bug to show the front desk and was told by the manager that the bug was not native to the Branson Area in effect accusing me of bringing the bug in an effort to get a free room night. There were other issues as the room being generally dirty. The quality of the Breakfast has decline to ie. quality of fruit very bad. Hot tub out of order for the 2 days we stayed and one of my requirements for a hotel is a working again more excuses.

Reviews.Title: “SEEMS WE'RE SHARING OUR ROOM......”
Reviews.Author: sagranger
Reviews.Content: A 5 day reunion was booked at this hotel. First impression is that the parking lot is on steep levels. Most of the parking involves climbing 27 steps or more to enter the hotel. Only 2 elevators to serve 9 floors. No bellhops are available. Dining room and lounge have limited hours. My main concern was the cleanliness of the room. The floor hasn't been swept during the entire stay. The bathroom wasn't cleaned daily. The shower mat is stained/old. Housekeeping staff woke us, in spite of the "DO NOT DISTURB" sign. The ice machine on this floor hasn't worked at all. I'm writing the review on my final night because I really don't want to go to bed. I noticed a series of bites on my legs, 2 days ago. I left a note, along with the daily tip, asking that the bedding be replaced and the mattress be treated. I trusted that it was done, but today, more bites appeared. My husband slept in the second bed and has bites also. We've traveled all over the world, but the GRAND PLAZA HOTEL is the only place we've encountered this problem. Have to agree with many of the reviews-avoid this hotel. Instead of an enjoyable visit, I'm now concerned about taking home unwanted guests, after my clothing and luggage have been here.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Plaza Hotel takes rudeness to new heights.”
Reviews.Author: HerculesMidwest
Reviews.Content: The front desk is VERY rude and condescending. We will NEVER sleep there again. We switched the hotel after 1 night and stayed at another hotel for the rest of the trip. Good thing we did. Otherwise our vacation could have been a total loss.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your Credit Card”
Reviews.Author: cdial75
Reviews.Content: Bought Tickets (reserved room) on Reservebranson.com , so I already paid for my room. Then they "accidentally" charged my Mastercard again. tieing it up with Charges that were their mistake, now my credit card is tied up, waiting for banks to transfer it back in, Big Headache. Make sure when you check in and out, if you've bought your tickets from somewhere else, that they dont double charge you. Also, when I called, you would have thought that they would have offered something for my troubles. But no. I just was told Sorry. And wait for your money. There's plenty of Hotels in Branson, dont think I'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Did not feel like a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTimePrecious
Reviews.Content: We live a little over an hour away, and come to Branson a few times a yr. We checked in with our kids, one age 20 the other age 16. The greeting at the front desk was business like but not friendly. We all felt instantly like we were being talked to like we were children, though I am in my late 40s and my husband in early 50s. The place smelled of cigarette smoke from our first step in the door. There is an open bowl of old apples at the desk, which one would have to be crazy to think of taking and eating. I thought the smell was the conference room, perhaps, but I did not see any smokers, and no matter where we went in the building the smell was there. The staff, where ever we encountered them, were not friendly. I am used to a 3 star hotel where every staff person you encounter smiles back at you, and when you say hello, they say hello back to you, from the front desk persons to the gift shop to the housekeepers, etc. This crew all look past you, giving the continued impression that you are not really welcome. There are paper signs taped in the rooms, warning you not steal the towels, and telling you how much it would cost you if you do, and also another little sign telling you that if you smoked in the non smoking room (which already smelled like smoke) it could cost you up to $500. The fitness room is LOCKED, right next to the pool, with another sign that says you have to go to the front desk to get permission to use it. So, we did not go ask for permission, and did not get to use the room that is advertised as one of the amenities. Getting scolded and warned by little paper signs everywhere we went is rather insulting. The funniest part of that is 99% of the other guests are even older than we are, look like mostly in their late 60sor later! So, who are you continuously scolding with your little signs everywhere? Are there rogue seniors who come in and abuse the fitness room and steal hand towels?? LOL. Then, after we had been out in Branson, had a late dinner, then a quick late night swim, we came back up to the room and the electricity went out!! Nothing! No air, no TV, no lights, no housekeeping or maintenance or security crew going around to check on the guests. I am SO glad we had not been on the elevator when the power went out!! We had been in the room for just a minute or two from the pool area when the power outage occurred. We called the front desk, and I understand she was suddenly overwhelmed, but she was unfriendly, and said "Ma'am, all of Branson is out! It's dark everywhere!" But looking out our window from the 8th floor, I could clearly see that was not true!! It was very difficult to try to manuever around the room using a cell phone for light, then to try to fall asleep...... once I did finally get to sleep, at 3 am everything came back on, so all of a sudden the lights and fan came to life, pulling me from a sleep I had just found! Then, was hard to go back to sleep again! The breakfast buffet in the morning was very nice, though we were tired and grumpy from the weird night. The pool was perfect temperature, and we had it to ourselves, which is always relaxing when that happens. The hot tub was also nice. Upon returning home, I see an email alert from our bank that a $20 charge was processed from the hotel, 'for incidentals'. I understand the whole "hold" thing on your account when you book a room, etc., but we paid for this ahead of time, and although we are assured that the $20 charge will be credited back early in the week, it is still just like another one of their little paper signs telling you not to steal things.... it was not a total disaster, but we will not stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “There is better”
Reviews.Author: jenby
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here for the past 4 years and each year it's gets worse. Pros: Yummy, free breakfast. Location Free wireless internet Decent price Cons: Parking Lot-there is no covered drop off area and they could use more parking. Not good for people in wheelchairs, because of the steep hills. Dirty laundry room, complete with dead and alive roaches. Lots of them! Dirty carpets Rooms just don't feel clean. Pool had too much chlorine in it last time and you could barely breathe in there. For our trip this Fall, we will be staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great place we loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: lvnmylife
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel from check in with Holly who was great and gave great directions to keep us off the 76 strip our room was very clean and comfortable the breakfast was great and saved us alot of money can't wait to go back!!! read alot of the other comments we did not have a problem with the wireless at all. The only drawback it was hilly but heck everything was.

Reviews.Title: “Was happy with this hotel, great value in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: LAERPA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the week of veterans day, a great time of year to go to Branson if you are a retiree. They had the hotel and the whole town decorated for Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Walklady
Reviews.Content: This was just an OK hotel for the money. I originally planned to make a reservation at the Best Western in Branson, but the tourism center highly suggested the Grand Plaza. It is an older hotel, in need of renovations. When you first walk into the lobby the smokey/musty smell hits you in the face -- other than that no real complaints. The breakfast buffet was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous!!!”
Reviews.Author: crabbygirl62
Reviews.Content: First off, we went with this hotel because of the Wi-fi. We never could use it. We stayed on the 7th floor, the elevators were very slow. One time we waited 6 times for the elevator. (meaning it would finally stop at our floor and it was completely packed so we weren't able to board). Another poster stated his credit card was compromised. Well guess what ours was too on this trip and we are currently having it investigated. The indoor pool's water was so nasty I refused to let my 17 year old son swim in it. I was so glad to get out of this hotel and go to Big Cedar.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: wey2bz
Reviews.Content: Definitely a 1 star hotel ... overpriced and 80s retro. Not enough electrical outlets in the room. The water stopped working in our room in the middle of my shower and the staff was RUDE when I called to see when it would be fixed. Breakfast was good. To top it off, my identity was stolen -- I booked my room via their website and only used the compromised card at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for a better experience”
Reviews.Author: GoldenGirls3
Reviews.Content: We had a smoking room because all three of us smoke. Odor was not offensive as in most smoking rooms. Staff and housekeeping were very friendly and helpful. Continental breakfast was a good, hot breakfast with small buffet, fruit, dry cereal, etc. Employees were helpful and friendly and nice area to eat. Location was great and was accessible to everything we did. Will definitely stay there again. We go to Branson at least once a year and found this hotel comparable to every place we have stayed and better than most of them.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Property - Very Rude Staff!”
Reviews.Author: JAW3
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this venue with a group of 52 - NOT GOOD! The rooms were not clean, and continued to not be properly cleaned after a four-night stay! Getting to and from the rooms took a lot of time - only two elevators for the big hotel. Taking the stairs was impossible as the stairwells were blue with smoke residue. When I personally lodged a complaint about a toilet running continuously and noisily and a hair dryer that did not work, a behind the desk person hung up on me. Is this appropriate behavior for a staff member to treat a guest - NOT ACCEPTABLE. Arrival is by the back entrance for a group, we arrived in and departed in rain, no portico provided for group guests convenient and safe arrival - NOT GOOD! In conclusion, I will not take my travelers there again and will also spread the word to all other tour attendants and companies to avoid this property!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY-- FRIENDLY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: JVCO
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with Pam who was the reservation person I spoke with, very friendly and supplied us with great information. Check in with Holly was also great telling us if there is anything we need, to let her know. The basket of apples was a nice treat at the front counter. We stayed in a family unit it was clean and a great lay out for our needs. The breakfast buffet was also great with alot of options and the staff there also very helpful. The gift shop helped with information on the different shows. I can not say any thing bad about this hotel. And when if I return to Branston I was definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “very loud”
Reviews.Author: madcow054
Reviews.Content: i will not stay in this hotell again. my wife baught me a vacation package last year and we recently took it. when we checked in it was ok. but went down from there. we got to our room there was no remote. the shower had very little water presure. they did bring us a new remote but it was gone the next day and had to get another one. the breakfast was ok the restraunt was outstanding. the last nite we (almost) stayed. they had a party on the 9 th floor.we were on the 8 th floor it sounded like they were in our room. when i complained they told me that they had payed a lot of money to rent the space and they would not do any thing to remedy the problem. so we checked out and went home., my wife is in a wheelchare this is not a handycap frindly place the walk ways are narrow and hard to navigate with the chare.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience with Online Reservations and NO Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: CommentsByMWtraveler
Reviews.Content: I made an online reservation a few months ago and then had to cancel 3 weeks prior. I responded to their confirmation, sent an online request with the confirmation number and cancellation details, and even called the hotel directly. I STILL got more confirmations about my alleged upcoming stay, and now I got an email thanking me for staying there. I have contacted the hotel no less than 20 times by email through their own website and have not received any type of reply. I strongly recommend you book somewhere else that has a website that works, and people working there who care. They clearly do not.

Reviews.Title: “50th Anniversary Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: IrishMom21
Reviews.Content: We took our family of 21 to celebrate our 50th Anniversary in Branson and had 6 rooms for 4 nights at the Grand Plaza Hotel. They gave us a corner space on the 7th floor and we were all close together. The staff was very friendly and we didn't have any problems with maid service. Everyone had different tastes and the free breakfast was better than we could have hoped for. The staff seemed especially helpful and friendly. We enjoyed the pool but it was hot and sometimes noisy. If we didn't get a parking place at the upper level, the walk to the lobby was quite a climb. But overall, the family was pleased and we would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Looks Good, But Musty”
Reviews.Author: Yallahs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Plaza Hotel for 2 nights and were very dissapointed with the hotel housekeeping. The property looks very nice from the outside, but upon entering the building, you are over-taken with the strong smell of the cholrine in the pool. We had a niice size king suite on the 8th floor and the room (air) in the room and hallway was very musty and stale. The rooms need a complete cleaning and sanitizing. The carpet was worn and smelly. Also the drapery and bedspread were old and smelly. The breakfast was okay, nothing too exciting. The resturant area was not kept up and the food area was not clean and presentable. The muffins were still frozen. I can't imagine anyone paying to eat lunch or dinner in the resturant just for the so-called view. The place is not clean. The parking is also a problem. When you return from seeing a show, there is no where close to park, so you have to park far and walk up hill to get to the hotel. We will not stay at this hotel again, even if it is free.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: housewifestl
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked so nice from the outside and even the lobby, but our room was dirty including the bathroom that had urine around the toilet. The pool area was really hot and then the pool water was warm and cloudy! Most of the staff was friendly except for one that I encountered at the free breakfast. The breakfast was good for it being free. But we will never stay there again, even my 2 kids who are 11 and 5 thought the room was gross.

Reviews.Title: “Satisified but not impressed”
Reviews.Author: SYE1967
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a total of 6 nights in the family suite. We loved the 2 bathroom/2 bedroom layout..the kids thought it was great. Housekeeping left a lot to be desired, they didn't even bother to empty the ice bucket or replace the dirty glasses with clean ones. We mentioned this to the front desk, however nothing improved. We had a constant 10 minute wait for the elevators in the morning, which with small children was very inconvenient. The pool/whirlpool was okay, but the chlorine was overwhelming....I had to take the children and leave twice due to the fumes. And the parking was horrible...who wants to climb a hill and 3 sets or steps to get into the hotel? For the price we paid ($170.00 a night) I was unimpressed and will look for a cabin or a condo for our next trip....we may not have maid service, but we didn't have any here either! Good Luck !!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here many times but big bed bug problems now. .”
Reviews.Author: DBFireWife
Reviews.Content: We visit Branson several times a year and always stay at the Grand Plaza Hotel, our daughter and her family come with us most of the time. .we were there this past week for 5 days and 4 nights. My daughter came home with bed bug bites, we will never stay here again. .The indoor pool is nice but the smell of chlorine is so strong it burns your eyes and irritates your lungs. I don't think there is enough ventilation in that area. Also, it rained and water poured in the window. I had to get up in the middle of the night and put towels on the window seal. I also think the overall cleanliness of the room and bathroom has gone downhill.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok”
Reviews.Author: zsmissouri
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 night. Our room as alright only one of the two elevators worked. They had it fixed on our last day. The breakfast buffet is pretty good. Overall it's ok.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty!”
Reviews.Author: mom2jt
Reviews.Content: When we entered the hotel, we noticed it had a distinct musky smell. It didn't get much better from there. While the front desk clerks were very nice and friendly, that was about the best thing we could say about the hotel. (except that the pool was nicely heated). The stairwells were all covered with cigarette butts and used plastic cups. Our hotel room comforter had cigarette burn marks on it, even though we had a "non-smoking" room. There was long curly hair in our shower before we used it. The shower head wasn't working properly and had to actually be propped up with our hands while using it. The hallways also were dirty and had cigarette butts scattered all over. Disgusting!!! Whoever is in charge of housekeeping/maintenance isn't doing a very good job.

Reviews.Title: “OK With Us”
Reviews.Author: ranran_24
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this hotel and we didn't have any problems with it. We had two queen beds and the room was clean and the bathroom was clean with plenty of towels. The breakfast was a pretty good breakfast for it being complimentary. Overall our stay was good, the only trouble we had was one of the room cards didn't work, but that was just a minor detail that we didn't even bother to tell the front desk about.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: agarton
Reviews.Content: The parking is truly a problem, and there are maybe 2 luggage carts in the entire hotel. The hotel staff are rude. The stairways are covered in cigarette butts. We woke up one morning to find no running water available anywhere in the hotel. Another night, someone walked into my room and then walked out. When it rained, water came into our room from the window. We didn't get the room we requested when we made the reservation. The breakfast was the best part of this hotel, and it was just okay.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: dknytn
Reviews.Content: After reading bad reviews on a different hotel, we cancelled our booking to stay here since it was listed as "luxury". The parking is nothing less than terrible. The parking in the rear is very small and fills fast. Your only other option is to park in the front which is on a hill, and several stairs. The times we did, there was trash on the steps. Our room was OK, but just as good as any other double queen room. Our bathtub would not drain on one occasion, and on another, our toilet backed up and flooded the floor. On their behalf, the maintenance guys showed up promptly, and resolved the issues quickly. Another note, the bathroom light over the sink looks to have a fan, but when I called the front desk to report the fan not working, the person stated that it is not a fan, but merely a vent.......hmmmmm. Anyway, everytime we took a shower, the mirror fogged up. The room was clean, and the A/C worked very well. The 9th floor breakfast was OK, at least it was warm. If we did it over again, we would have stayed in the other hotel. Just our 2 cents worth.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Value”
Reviews.Author: dayonthebeach
Reviews.Content: I booked the reservation and used my Silver Dollar City season pass for a 20% discount back in Jan. 2007. When I read the last 2 reviews, I became a bit concerned, but it was too late to change plans. I just got back today and wanted to make sure I wrote a good review of the place. We, (myself, husband, mother, 3 children) stayed in the Family Suite. It is basically 2 rooms connected to each other. We went to the pool and hot tub, (which is open from 9:00 am to midnight). It was clean and they had plenty towels for us to use. The fitness room was 24/7 ...all you have to do is get a key from the front desk. They had an eliptical, treadmil, and exercise bike and they looked like they were fairly new. We had dinner at the restaurant on the 9th floor and it was good. Big portions, friendly waitress, free dessert, and the only smoking we saw were patrons in the lounge area. The nightly entertainment, Kenny Parrott was really good. He plays guitar and sings the country oldies...my mom LOVED IT.. (she even bought a CD) The deluxe continental breakfast was really good...for being the free meal provided with your stay. (eggs, sausage, potatoes, biscuits and gravy, waffles, fruit, cereal, pastries,muffins, toast...did I forget anything?) And we were able to check our email on my husband's laptop with the free WI-FI. My only complaint would be that housekeeping probably could have done a little better job cleaning the room. My family had a great and affordable vacation. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Plaza”
Reviews.Author: DSTLady
Reviews.Content: My husband I sayed at the Grand Plaza last weekend (3/16/07). Overall, it was OK. The woman at the front desk wasn't very pleasant when we asked to be moved to a different room due to loud teenagers on our floor, when we did get a new room the room key didn't work and each time we returned to our room we had to go back to the front desk for assistance. The room was clean and the bed slept OK. The cleaning stafff is somewhat slow, we left in the morning and returned late afternoon and our room still had not been cleaned, however the cleaning staff was very nice. The 9th floor breakfast was terrible!! I would advise going out for breakfast. We probably would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service, however, NOT impressed with general hotel....”
Reviews.Author: eliz_82
Reviews.Content: In general, our stay at the Grand Plaza wasn't bad, however, my husband and I were not at all impressed with the Grand View resturant they offer on the 9th floor. It was horrible! They allowed smoking within the restuarant, in fact, our waitress was smoking in between waiting our table. The food was gross too, it wasn't the least bit appetizing. I will admit, though, that the customer service was good. Our bath tub didn't work in two different rooms that we were moved to, therefore, they upgraded us to a Suite for free. Overall experience, good, but don't eat their food.

Reviews.Title: “Three Cheers!!!”
Reviews.Author: Betheedood
Reviews.Content: My two sisters and I got away by ourselves for the weekend. We stayed in the "Family Suite" on the 5th floor at the Grand Plaza Hotel. I'm pretty picky when it comes to hotels, but one of my sisters is worse than me, so I was a little worried, since I did the booking. When we walked into our room, my sisters and I were so excited! We loved the decor. The valley view was splendid! This suite has two seperate bedrooms, ( which we needed, since my other sister snores and we have to shut her door ) Hee Hee! It has two full baths. One of the tubs has jets, ( which I needed because I have a lot of pain, and this seems to help ~ just DON'T put bubble bath in it! ) Hee Hee! The price was very affordable for the three of us to split. The staff was friendly. We enjoyed our continental breakfast as we reminisced and laughed, looking out into the beautiful valley, ( Loved those Dixie Creme Doughnuts! ) We had a WONDERFUL time, and our hotel stay helped make it such. The only thing missing was our precious Mother. Three Sisters - Leawood, Overland Park & Topeka, Kansas.

Reviews.Title: “Grand time at the Grand Plaza”
Reviews.Author: TravelFan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July 2006. This hotel was very nice in my opinion, definitely a 3*+ hotel. It is built on a hill, so there are two levels for parkng. The lobby is on the lower level. They had everything ready for us at check in and the desk clerks were always helpful and friendly. They had apples for guests at the front desk. There are two main elevators, but we found a small elevator at the end of our hallway that was much more convenient. Our room had 2 queen beds, a desk, dresser, two chairs, and a place for luggage. It also has a blow dryer, iron, ironing board, and free wireless internet. The room was a bit "crowded," especially with four of us staying in the room and all this furniture. The room looked brand new. IIt's obvious the hotel has had recent rennovations. The bathroom had granite counter tops and large ceramic tile on the floor, with new pre-fab shower/bath. Our room and hall were very quiet. They have a complimentary continental breakfast on the 9th floor each morning. It is okay, but I wish they had the waffle maker like so many other hotels have these days. We ate one night at their restaurant and it was very tasty food and good service. Maybe the best is the beautiful view from the 9th floor looking out over Branson. The Tanger Mall is close, but uphill from the hotel, so it's probably better to drive over there. We thorougly enjoyed our stay at this lovely hotel. It is definitely one of the nicer hotels in Branson, so it costs a bit more. It was perfect for our little gang.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good for the Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend in Branson. We had a decent stay at the Grand Plaza Hotel. It was clean and the service was above average. The Grand Plaza offers a nice continental breakfast. We expected only a few tid bits but it included a spread with pastries, cereal, hard boiled eggs, bagels, toast, fruit, etc... (A little above average for this type of hotel) The pool was an average size for the Branson area and it was indoor. Our kids are 11 and 14 and they enjoyed it. We paid $69 per night for a room with an internet coupon which we thought was an excellent value. There were 2 double beds so the four of us shared. Overall, I would say this is probably is one of the best hotels we have stayed in and I am extremely fussy! Perhaps not the most luxiourous hotel but if you want an average hotel at a decent price this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Grand Plaza Hotel around the 2nd week of December. Most entertainment was shut down fof the winter. The traffic was almost none existance. The hotel was clean, nice and comfortable. The employees were very friendly and helpful. We would definately staythere again and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: 52inayear
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff and with an internet coupon, our room rate was $59.00, so excellent bargain. Location a plus too.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amdphoto
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Friday, December 2, 2005. We had a family suite (Room 417) and it was clean and neat. I was concerned that being next to the mechanical room and elevator would be too noisy. It was very quiet though. The parking lot is steep. You check in at the lower level and then can park around top at the first floor entrance which is not steep. The continental breakfast provided was perfect. They had fruit, yogurt, donuts, bagels, toast, oatmeal, cereal, hard boiled eggs, juice and coffee. It was perfect to start the day. The heated pool was nice. Not too warm. The hot tub was nice and hot but needed to be slightly cleaned. The only complaints I have is that after swimming on Sunday morning I returned to my room in my bathing suit and my key would not work. I went to the front desk and the front desk clerk indicated that the keys are deactivated one hour before checkout (11:00 a.m.) and they are trying to get that changed. I also requested a late check out of 12:00 p.m. to a woman at the front desk. She said that's fine. Then I received a telephone call at 11:30 a.m. from someone asking for housekeeping. I told her this wasn't housekeeping and she indicated she was checking if we would be staying another day. I told her that I had called and spoke with a woman and asked for a late checkout. Small lack of communication. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just Ok, by far not the worst hotel, but by far not the best either. Staff was friendly, I found the pool area dirty, cobwebs on the windows, mildew in areas, needed a good paint job on the walls. We also encountered several black bugs in the room and pool area. Restaurant was adequate but outdated. Parking was an issue, difficult to find close parking spots, very steep steps to front lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed reviews”
Reviews.Author: TravelGoddest
Reviews.Content: The hotel from the outside was very nice. The front desk staff was wonderful. We upgraded to a what they called a mini-suite. All it came with was a sofa, microwave, and a fridge. I personally wouldn't of called this a suite. But it was only an extra $15.00 a night. The room wasn't the cleanest, there was a water bottle lid left on the floor and tape all over the ceiling. Overall it was a nice hotel, I am sure it is nicer than most of the hotels in Branson. The Grand Plaza View Restaurant ran out of food on the Saturday night of of stay, and the bar ran out of most of their liquor. This was a is a disappointment. the staff at the restaurant were drinking and smoking while they were working. Pretty unsanitary.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Plaza Hotel, Branson”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were guests of the hotel twice this winter, as we traveled down to check on Lake house being built. We found the hotel very clean, bright, freindly staff and the best for the money! We would definitely recommend The Grand Plaza to our freinds and relatives.

HotelInfo.Name: Grand Plaza Hotel Branson
HotelInfo.Address: 245 North Wildwood Drive, Branson, MO 65616
